question: Why did Mrs. Turner speak so disparagingly about Booker T. Washington?
answer: Mrs. Turner spoke disparagingly about Booker T. Washington because of her deeply held colorist beliefs and worship of Caucasian characteristics. As a dark-skinned Black man, Washington represented the opposite of what she valued. She accused him of 'cutting the monkey for white folks' - meaning she believed he demeaned himself to gain white approval and was 'pomped up' by whites as a result. She also criticized his emphasis on work and manual labor, claiming 'He didn't do nothin' but hold us back—talkin' 'bout work when de race ain't never done nothin' else.' To Mrs. Turner, Washington was 'uh white folks' nigger' - an enemy to Black people because he didn't advance the cause of lighter-skinned, more 'white-featured' African Americans like herself. Her brother shared these views and reportedly 'tore him tuh pieces' in a paper at a Sunday School Convention.
quote: 'Sposed tuh be. All he ever done was cut de monkey for white folks. So dey pomped him up. But you know whut de ole folks say 'de higher de monkey climbs de mo' he show his behind' so dat's de way it wuz wid Booker T... He didn't do nothin' but hold us back—talkin' 'bout work when de race ain't never done nothin' else. He wuz uh enemy tuh us, dat's whut. He wuz uh white folks' nigger.
